text: Jean-Louis Servan-Schreiber (31 October 1937 – 28 November 2020) was a French journalist and human rights activist. He was the co-founder of L'Expansion and the founder of Psychologies and Radio Classique. He was the author of several books. He was born in Boulogne-Billancourt, France. He was a member of the Human Rights Watch from 2007 until his death. Servan-Schreiber died on 28 November 2020 in Paris of COVID-19, aged 83.Jean-Louis Servan-Schreiber est décédé ==References== Category:2020 deaths Category:1937 births Category:French journalists Category:French human rights activists Category:French Jews Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Paris Category:Writers from Boulogne-Billancourt
title: Jean-Louis Servan-Schreiber
